title: Nothing sorted
body: Went to ent at St Richards because I had earache for months and tinnitus worse. Dr very pleasant noticed my voice was gravelly. Put me through for speech therapy for voice. Mentioned earache and tinnitus again said just age. Left feeling a total waste of time, my problem with the earache was not discussed further.

title: Improved service at IMC
body: I popped in to the surgery without an appointment to enquire about blood test results. The receptionist was most helpful, and an equally helpful and friendly nurse then took me through my test results. This is the second very satisfactory experience I have had  recently. I have noticed a big improvement in the attitude and helpfulness of the staff at IMC.

title: great practice
body: I'm very grateful to all the staff at the surgery and the pharmacy for their help over the past few months, especially given the pressures they're under. The front line staff are friendly and helpful, the medical staff are amazingly patient and understanding and the pharmacy staff are equally helpful.  All this means that I don't feel over-anxious when I need to contact them and as I live with chronic anxiety I am really thankful for that.

title: Fabulous care
body: We have been on F5 today. The staff were amazing with my daughter and I can't thank you enough. Spotlessly clean and every member of staff went out of their way to make my daughter feel at ease

title: Lovely hospital /staff/good patient care
body:
This is my first visit to  the accident and emergency  department and Warrington hospital 
It was very busy  when I arrived.
 There was a wait due to how busy they were,  but it was ok vending machines there to keep you going.
The staff that looked after me were  good 
 from the  Drs  nursing night and  day staff. Cleaners, reception staff and porters they all work really hard and are.   
friendly nothing  is too much trouble The drs  and nursing staff were also very good and caring  and explained things  well and the investigations they were  doing, despite the conditions of being on trolleys in corridors I still felt very much looked after and included in my care.
I would definitely recommend  anybody to go to Warrington hospital.

title: Excellent Doctors practice
body: Today I went to get my covid booster jab & blood test. River Brook Medical Centre are working tirelessly to ensure all their staff and patients are kept safe. The organisation at the centre is excellent and extremely efficient. The staff and volunteers are so dedicated and committed and doing a great job. Thank to all the staff your efforts are very much appreciated. I feel very privileged to be a patient at this surgery nothing is ever too much trouble.

title: Fantastic Staff
body: My daughter was recently admitted to Louisa Cary ward, after having a high temperature due to covid. The treatment she received was fantastic. I cannot fault any member of staff from this department. Nothing was too much trouble, we were regularly checked on to see if we were ok, cleaning was regular and thorough, meals were delicious and on time and every single member of staff were so friendly. Thank-you for looking after my daughter, you all went above and beyond to make sure she (and I!) we’re ok.

readBy.name: Torbay and South Devon NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic staff
body: I recently took my daughter to the emergency department after not being able to control her high temperature. (After a PCR it was established it was covid) The care she received was second to none. Every single member of staff were quick to help her, friendly and did everything in their power to get her better quickly. I honestly cannot thank-you enough.

readBy.name: Torbay and South Devon NHS Foundation Trust

author: AnnMc
title: Managing my scaniexty
body:
I just wanted to take some time to comment on the Imaging Service (CT scanning) provided at the NI Cancer Centre.  
I have secondary breast cancer which has spread to the lungs. My cancer is incurable with a median life expectancy of 2 to 3 years. I am on treatment at present and attend the Cancer Centre for chemotherapy every three weeks.  
The cancer itself, the treatments and their side effects, and the regular scanning are all quite demanding and debilitating.  
I attend CT Imaging every three months to assess if my palliative treatment is working and keeping my cancer stable. As you can imagine this is a hugely stressful routine as I manage my life from one three monthly scan to the next. News of a stable scan allows me to live my best life possible for the following months until the next scan. I am not an anxious person and am very positive, having sought out many interventions to keep me positive and well, both physically and mentally, however scaniexty is a real issue.  
My Cancer Nurse who supports Dr McAleer, June, and Majella, the CT Service Manager have been absolutely excellent in managing the scanning appointments and processes in a very professional, efficient and compassionate manner, and have reduced the scanxiety as much as possible.  
June organises my scans routinely at exactly the right time and I never have to chase them. Majella then organizes Infusional Services to access my portacath on the day of the scan so that my veins are saved as much as possible. The CT staff are extremely efficient - I have never experienced any delays in the two years that I have attended the Imaging Service. As well as being very efficient, there is no sense of a conveyor belt service with the patient feeling like a statistic in terms of numbers processed each day. The very opposite is true, with staff recognising me from previous appointments, taking an interest in my ongoing wellbeing and genuinely showing true compassionate care.  
The staff work as a team with Infusional Services and show a real interest in understanding how the potacath in my chest is accessed for CT contrast.  
As well as professional, safe, efficient and compassionate care shown during the scanning process, the Imaging Centre is a welcoming space for patients. Although small, it is extremely clean and well laid out with excellent notices for patients. There is a true ethos of listening to patients concerns and making service improvements that matter to patients. I previously noted that the waiting room was very cold in winter and very warm in summer and noticed that other patients had commented on this as it was clearly stated on the Care Opinion Notice Board, together with the corrective action taken. At my last visit the waiting area was indeed a much better temperature for patients.  
The appointment letters are also very informative and explain exactly what in involved in the scanning process; they offer help to patients if they need it and explain when and where patients need to go and what is required beforehand. Covid safety checks are also always undertaken which is reassuring for cancer patients who are immunosuppressed.  
All the above important aspects of a good patient experience do not happen by chance but are down to excellent leadership and a well-trained and caring team. Majella and her team provide an excellent service to patients day-in-day-out, and this makes a huge difference to patients such as myself who routinely attend hospital and for whom scanning means such a great deal in terms of our quality of life.  
I am more than happy to give verbal feedback in addition to this written piece.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

title: Fantastic staff
body: I recently took my daughter to the emergency department after not being able to control her high temperature. (After a PCR it was established it was covid) The care she received was second to none. Every single member of staff were quick to help her, friendly and did everything in their power to get her better quickly. I honestly cannot thank-you enough.

readBy.name: Torbay and South Devon NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent Nurses and service
body: My son who has Down's Syndrome had a large abscess and on consultation with the Nurse practitioner was directed by her to the emergency day surgery unit at the hospital. The abscess was excised and drained by the doctor and he attended the unit for cleaning and packing for several days, after which  Queensview took over his treatment. The Nurse who attended was both caring and professional and you couldn't have received better treatment. After she discharged him a further check up with another Nurse was undertaken and once again great service was received. Without the treatment that my son received the outcome could have meant that a longer period of visits may have been required. I agree that sometimes it takes awhile to communicate via the telephone, however the treatment of my son has always been first rate by the medical team. Well done!

title: Very good and friendly practice
body: Everyone is polite and so helpful from start to the end and have passion of helping patients and colleagues alike.

author: atlascb45
title: Great service and care
body:
The level of care by all members of staff is excellent and beyond reproach.  
I feel very reassured and confident in their care ( this extends to all members of staff , including secretarial)  
A potential problem was identified and promptly investigated and was then referred to another team for further tests.  
The Centre staff continue to support me with regular feedback.  
Staff always get back in touch when they say they will.  
Great service and care.

readBy.name: Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

title: Fantastic Staff
body: came as a very apprehensive patient for an MRI Scan staff were very supportive caring and in every way professional. Thank you

title: Great practice
body: Been a patient for many years. I have no complaints. Staff are competent and friendly. All the doctors I have seen are very efficient and friendly and caring. All extremely helpful. If anything the practice has improved over the years.

author: Mdy27
title: Visit for blood tests
body: So well organised, being greeted and directed at the front door makes such a huge difference in such uncertain times. The Phlebotomy department was superb and staff went out of their way to help and explain, a huge thank you.

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Exceptional vaccination efforts
body: I had my booster jab in the village hall run by Swallowfield Medical Practice. Every single member of staff was so efficient and kind, despite the fact they must be run off their feet! The practice manager and all the staff, nurses and doctors all deserve a huge kudos - so thank you, thank you very much.

title: Lovely Nurse
body:
I had a lovely nurse looking after me for my day gynaecology surgery. I can’t remember her name but I know she was there 4 years and had a tattoo on her forearm. 
She was attentive, kind, caring and could find common ground (apparently when I woke up from anaesthetic I was talking to her about the film The Holiday). 
She provided all the information that was needed and went through the information with both myself and my friend! 
An true asset to have at Tavistock hospital and I am very grateful I was under her care!

title: My Experience Could Not Have Been Better
body: As this was a new experience for me you can appreciate I was extremely apprehensive. However, as soon as I met the team I was immediately reassured and felt at ease. Before the procedure it was explained to me exactly what was going to take place. The young lady that carried out the procedure ( Flexible Cystoscopy) was extremely compassionate and reassuring throughout the procedure which by the way was totally painless. The Hospital it’s self was spotless and very well organised. All the staff I came in contact with where extremely pleasant and helpful. I cannot praise the Corbett Hospital and Staff enough. I appreciate all the hard work they put in to insure patients have an excellent experience during difficult times for both parties. I wish you all a Merry Christmas and Prosperous New Year. Thank You All.

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very helpful , thorough and efficient .
body: I am a new patient , and have been greatly impressed by the kindness ,care and professionalism of all staff .All three receptionist s that I have spoken to in turn ,have been wonderful and I cannot fault anyone. When I reported a rather concerning health problem recently , I was seen by the Dr. the very same day , which I was very impressed with and most thankful for the kindness I received.

title: wonderful care
body:
I attended the Fitzwilliam for a Gynae procedure and i can not fault the care i was given from admission to discharge, every Nurse, Dr, Anaesthetist and Catering staff that came through my door was courteous, caring and professional to my needs.  You made me feel very special and i thankyou for that, especially upon discharge i had forgotten to take my stockings away with me and 2 days later a pair arrive in the post. Its the small details like that that made me feel special.  In all what is happening around us right now a nurse remembering that i had not taken them with me and posting them was the icing on the cake and i thankyou all for caring for me so well.  I hope you all have a wonderful Xmas you all deserve it.
Andrea Stevens

title: Help with disabled daughter
body: In these pressured times I can only give praise  for the help I have had with my daughter if they said they would do something the surgery has arranged this the Dr has been very understanding to her needs also the receptionists have taken time to listen to her when she calls the surgery many thanks

title: God practice
body: Group surgery was very professional in sorting my problem with my prescription within two hours so I could get my medication when needed

author: kara1712
title: Fantastic maternity experience
body:
I had the best experience giving birth at Inverurie Community Maternity Unit. From start to finish I felt looked after, listened to and involved in the whole process. The midwives were nothing short of amazing. They managed to make me feel like I was in the safest possible hands but also like I was in full control of the situation. They were so knowledgeable, extremely professional, very friendly and genuinely caring. The environment was the perfect balance of professional and super clean and warm and welcoming. The facilities are fantastic. The entire staff couldn’t have done more for us during our time there. They didn’t just care for myself and my baby but my husband too, making sure he didn’t feel like I spare part but totally involved.  
This is my first baby and as usual you get all the horror stories and scaremongering. I knew a lot of people had been put off giving birth in a midwife unit because of the pain relief options or chance of being transferred to a hospital, but I can’t recommend it enough for a first time mum. I can honestly say that the care we received, not just during the labour but immediately after and in the weeks to follow has given us the best possible start we could have asked for as a family.  
During my pregnancy I was given the impression by some that once your baby is here then the focus is only on them. I didn’t find this to be true in my experience, the midwives were so caring towards me, always asking how I was as well as asking about my baby. I had had very little experience of caring for a baby before having my own one and the midwives were so helpful, taking the time to help me with feeding and changing, offering tips and advice along the way. There was absolutely no judgment whatsoever and I felt like I could ask them anything.  
The experience as a whole was fantastic and I wouldn’t hesitate for a second in recommending Inverurie Community Maternity Unit.

title: Excellent Staff
body: I have been a patient at Welcome Practice for 11 years. I am always well greeted with a smile by the staff especially the Manager and they take care of my health needs. Thank you for looking after me.

author: cafecf76
title: Understanding service
body: I feel more at ease now. The nurse I saw was lovely and it was really nice to see a profession that understands bpd and how many different aspects of your life it can affect. I can not thank you enough for seeing me and being so kind to me it goes a long way just having someone to talk about all your worries to.

author: Charlotte w
title: Thorough and reassuring service
body: I was nervous and embarrassed. The team were through and reassuring. Cannot rate them highly enough!

author: Dermat88
title: Professional and reassuring service
body:
On Saturday night I was unfortunate to have been involved in an accident in Galgorm. I have to say that Karl and Stephen were the first medical crew on the scene. Karl, a student Paramedic, took complete control of the situation while Stephen was on hand to reassure me everything would be ok. It's a real scary and traumatic situation when the roof of your vehicle has to removed to get you out of your car.  
These two gentlemen stayed with me all the way, reassuring and medicating me for the pain. I would really like to personally thank Karl and Stephen for their support and marvellous professionalism towards me that night. I think they said they were from the Ballymoney station.  
Once again my sincere and heartfelt thanks to all ambulance personnel and all the the Emergency services who attended that night.  
Forever Grateful

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: PureGallus
title: Totally let down
body:
Unfortunately I feel totally let down by one of the community midwives in South Ayrshire, regularly ignoring attempts to get in contact with her, and who processed a urine sample over a month ago that wasn't properly sent for investigation, leaving me, at 27-31 weeks pregnant with an untreated UTI.  
I had had no care since early November, and eventually broke down and requested another midwife. Thankfully, they booked me into AMU immediately for observation and a checkup, and thankfully baby is fine. I've been largely unsupported my entire pregnancy, and as a first time mum with a high risk pregnancy, I'm terrified and have even more trust issues with the NHS now.  
Thanks so much to my new midwife.

author: authenticcw75
title: Feeling the benefits of Pulmonary Rehabilitation
body: After suffering with severe copd and struggling with breathlessness, I attended the rehab course in Ollerton. I was educated how to help my COPD and am slowly feeling the benefits. I just want to thank Alex. Jo and Alex. Thank you

author: Belfast 1980
title: Feeling assured that I will be well looked after
body:
I became unwell in March 2021 and was admitted to ward 6B from the emergency department in the RVH Belfast. I was very unwell and stayed for almost a month. I am usually very able bodied, and found being unable to do basic tasks myself very embarrassing and stressful.  
The entire team on 6B, and on numerous later stays, 6A, were amazing. It took me a while to realise the difference between nurses and health care assistants as each was as professional and caring as the other. I was assisted in every way I needed physically. Aaron was an absolute star and I have encountered him on each return stay. His kind, friendly and caring attitude has never changed. I hear him speak to other patients and he is a real down to earth, comforting person.  
There are way too many nurses to mention but the ones who stand out in my mind are Sijy, a lovely lady who was professional, kind and very caring. Rose, who looked after me for most of my first stay, such a smiley (despite the mask) and gentle person, and Judith who kept my family informed and reassured during a difficult time when I wasn’t able to communicate with them.  
Karen from 6A also took great care of me on more recent stays and had a wonderful way with the student nurses. She had a lot of time and knowledge to share. I am sure that they will do well under her tuition. I’ve also had many visits to the SAMS clinic at the Royal and been looked after by some amazing and experienced nurses like Mary, Anna, Lisa and Michele, as well as the numerous consultants I’ve seen there. This clinic was a great place for me when I needed help and advice.  
I’m not yet finished my treatment and may have more stays, but I feel assured that I will be well looked after.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Daiwp34
title: Fantastic people doing an amazing job
body:
Had vulval biopsies at Pilgrim Hospital today. The staff were amazing, put me at ease and supported me all way through.  
Dr Harry, nurse Rachel and HC Janet, fantastic people doing an amazing job

title: Understanding
body: I have a fear of needles so any blood tests or vaccinations always make me nervous. I had to go for two blood tests and both nurses were so lovely and understanding. I explained how I felt and both nurses were understanding and let me chat away to them while they did it. It’s such a little thing but makes such a difference.

title: Good Service
body: I find it easy that I can fill in the form and get an appointment.  And the waiting for an appointment doesn't take long.so far I spoke to 4 different doctors and they all listern to my issue well.

title: Ambulance Team and 111 were excellent
body: Received excellent assistance from team on Ambulance whilst being moved from WSH to Norfolk/Norwich, Amazing girls and great team spirit, couldn't have been more caring, I think they were from the Sudbury Base, Please pass on my thanks to all of them, they may remember me as none of them could unlock the Ambulance to get me inside but had great banter, credit to this Crew, the 111 operations and both Hospitals concerned,  the service and speed deserves Recognition.

readBy.name: East Of England Ambulance Service NHS Trust

title: Great practice
body:
Staff are friendly, kind and caring staff. 
I had my covid booster there, it was efficient and clean. 
Thank you for all your hard work.

title: Wonderful staff and service
body: I regularly receive chemotherapy in the Seamoore unit. I can honestly say that all the Doctors, nurses and support staff are absolutely brilliant. They are all under such pressure but never complain. They are both very professional and caring and always make time to ensure you are ok. Can’t thank all of the staff enough for their efforts and kindness. Hope they all get chance to enjoy Christmas. Kindest regards. Clive with the colourful shirts.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Kells1980
title: Made to feel relaxed and safe
body:
Had to go for endoscopy today. Felt nervous as quite an invasive procedure. Staff were amazing. Very friendly and informative, were able to have some humour, made me feel relaxed and safe. You can see they take pride in their work and are very knowledgeable in the job they do.  
Thank you

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

title: Thank you
body: I have no faults what so ever for ARS. I have never been refused an appointment and the staff and Doctors have always been so reassuring. I work in a surgery and I am a bit of a hypochondriac! But the receptionists/GPs/Paramedics and Nurses have always accommodated for any tests, appointments or reassurance I've needed. It's been a hellish year for the NHS and hats off to the staff at ARS for holding down the Fort. Thank you.

title: Well Run Surgery
body: Today I went to the practice for my covid booster, I was really impressed with the organisation and the staff we’re excellent. Thanks team!

author: ShonnyCJ
title: Well planned vaccination service
body:
Excellent service. Very well planned, appointment at 7.40pm, out by 8pm.  
Thank you NHS Fife.

author: Robdw84
title: Treated with care and compassion
body:
Have just been discharged from ward 5c following a almost 3 week stay with breathing difficulties.During my stay I was treated with care and compassion, my wife and myself were kept informed at all times.  
The staff were warm and caring  
I was looked after and all of my concerns were addressed up to and including the arrangements for my discharge home via ambulance services which went smoothly.

author: Sparkhill23
title: Efficient, caring, helpful, and understanding staff
body:
2 weeks ago, my husband had a scheduled CT scan on his heart,  
3 days later we were phoned from the Cardiology Dept.with the results, and my husband was told to get to the Hospital as soon as possible, to be admitted. He was originally on the same unit over night, then admitted to AMU1 for a few days and finally to Cardio Investigation Ward. He was in hospital for a total of 8 days.  
In all that time, the staff were so efficient, caring, helpful, and understanding of my husband's other health issues. We would both like it to be known, that the staff at Treliske, from those in Security and especially those on the wards mentioned,were absolutely brilliant.  
I was able to visit my husband and could see for myself, how busy and hectic it was. To all the staff at Treliske, you are very special people, and we want you to know how grateful we are to you all. My husband is home now and slowly starting to recover from his treatment. Once again, many thanks to the staff who looked after him.  
We wish you a Happy Christmas. With, kindest regards,  
[Unsure about 'Staff skills']  
  
[Unsure about 'Team work']  
  
[Unsure about 'Being listened to']  
  
[Unsure about 'Care staff']  
  
[Unsure about 'Doctor']

author: Soye.3
title: Exceptional care and attention
body:
I've been in Crozier house since September and would like to let it be known the care and attention given to me has been exceptional.  
The staff have been extremely attentive and have to be commended for the work they do. The chef's have been kind and considerate even the times I have been really unwell. I am truly thankful that such a place exists for myself and others in there time of need.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Amazing staff at all levels
body: This practice goes above and beyond to help whenever they can. The staff from reception to Nurses to Doctors and anyone I’ve missed give a wonderful service under the constraints of the system! We are all too quick to overlook the big picture and focus on ourselves and needs! In my experience Brunel have never let me down and always given first class service-Thank you all.

author: chamaeleonmc97
title: Excellent care
body:
Recently I was not feeling too well around 6pm despite trying to treat myself, but I phoned NHS24 who must have been very busy as it was half an hour before I spoke to a call handler who passed my symptoms to the duty clinician.  
The outcome was a 12 mile journey from my home to the Moray GDocs medical clinic at The Oaks Hospice in Elgin. I was seen by the duty Nurse Steven who was very thorough and reassuring throughout my visit for treatment.  
Sincere thanks to all involved as my pain was relieved after being administered an NSAID injection by the empathetic Nurse Steven who also changed my dressings as well as checking out the site where surgery had taken place 10 days prior.

readBy.name: Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

title: Excellent assistance remotely
body:
I now live on the European continent but needed access to old medical records.
The team was exceptionally helpful and resolved my quickly with great pace. Only took a day after initial response from the team! Most happy and satisfied

title: Wonderful staff, brilliant care
body: Filled in an E-consult and had a call within two hours. Nurse practitioner was brilliant. Very caring and reassuring. Have had to use the surgery several times this year and every time whether it’s been online, on the phone or in person they have been amazing and to then run all the vaccination clinics alongside this and keep patients up to date with information is incredible. Real stars. Thank you.

title: What to say
body: From reception to the nurses doctors super kind and more to the point knowledgeable. Obviously I highly recommend.

author: eridanusyd35
title: Bad experience at Stoke Mandeville Hospital
body:
Disappointingly I have had a bad experience with Stoke Mandeville Hospital. My father is in his 90s and fell at home; we called an ambulance and he was taken to Stoke Mandeville Hospital. The good news is that in less than 24 hours he was discharged, very sore and bruised but with nothing broken. Most of the staff I talked to were fantastic however the way everything is organised and managed is shambolic. I seriously wonder if there is anyone managing this hospital.  
I was told to call A&E after 4 hours but, in my experience, they almost never answer the phone or the phone rings for 10 minutes and then ends the call with a message 'sorry no-one is available'. Over a period of 5 hours, starting at 08.30 in the morning, I rang 9 times and I only got through once. When I did I was immediately put on hold for 5 minutes as 'all the computer systems had gone down'. Answering a phone does not require a Doctor or Nurse, just an administrator to give the most basic information.  
When you are trying to find information on an elderly parent this is really distressing. All I needed was some to tell me he had been admitted and was being assessed. Then I eventually got a call saying I could come and collect him, and there was a bizarre system which required me to queue with the A&E patients to say I was there and then wait with them until my father came out. In total I had to wait nearly an hour in this crowded area which seems to be a bit crazy given I was told he was ready and the current Covid situation.  
Then when he did appear he was limping along on the arm of a nurse. I asked how he was expected to walk all the way to the car park and they said I could go and get my car and drive up to the A&E entrance which would have been crazy as it is a single lane being used uniquely by ambulances not to mention this would have required him climbing over the barrier specifically designed to prevent this. So they reluctantly went and got a wheelchair whilst both of us waited in the crowded A&E waiting area.  
At the end of August last year my father had to go to Wexham Park Hospital following a similar fall and we had a fantastic experience. I was called by a Doctor or Nurse several times during the 12 hours he was in the hospital and when he was discharged they told me to let them know when I arrived and to wait outside (to minimise the Covid risk). Then a porter wheeled him out and took him all the way to my car in the car park. I do understand that the NHS is under massive pressure due to Covid-19 and that all the staff are working incredibly hard but that was also the case last August. Stoke Mandeville appear to be creating problems due to poor management.

readBy.name: Steve Baker's Office, MP for Wycombe

author: Nath1985
title: Alcohol abuse and recovery.
body:
A year ago I was having to be carried down the stairs of my sisters' house with the most extreme nausea and uncontrollable shaking. I felt like I was going to die. This is not an exaggeration. I had my last 25ml shot of vodka roughly about 6 hours before. I was just about to start my detox.  
It got bad, really bad. I couldn’t go any more than a few hours without needing a drink and I would drink anything. However Vodka was the main poison of choice, it was easy to conceal and cheap. Well that’s what I had been telling myself for years anyway. I was drinking between 1 to 1.5 litres of it a day and that’s not including the added beers, wine, ciders, cocktail cans alongside. I would fill up a water bottle for the commute to work or just to carry on me throughout the day. In the very early hours of the morning I would find myself on the toilet with the bottle of poison next to me, drinking enough to either attempt to go about my day the best I could or go back to sleep on the sofa for a few hours. It was a very frightening and solitary existence.  
On paper I had no reason to be this way, I had a loving girlfriend, secure job and a comfortable roof over my head. However, clearly something wasn’t right. What that something was didn't matter at this moment in time, I just knew something had to change.  
My physical and mental health had deteriorated immensely , it really was a case of do something now or die. Again no exaggeration there.  
So i reached out to my older sister for help and that's when we decided to get in contact with Inclusion.  
Although not the easiest of times due to COVID restrictions, I was able to participate in group sessions online of 'alcohol awareness' and 'acceptance and commitment therapy', along with regular one to one conversations with my recovery worker. Finally, I was ready (I didn’t feel ready) to start my detox at my sisters house, with her administrating the medication needed along with the absolutely amazing support from the nurses at Inclusion. I quite literally owe all of these people my life. With support after finishing the detox by attending the Inclusion Recovery Program, mentored by Andy, and One to One sessions with my recovery worker, Aaron, they’ve given me the mental tools, focus and drive to get going with my life!  
And a life is what I have now, not just an intense struggle to get through each hour or even minute of the day. It is in no way by any means perfect or without its difficulties. However In this one year since my detox I have bought a house with my partner, been to two weddings (sober!), maintained my job role with more energy and bought some home studio recording equipment with the money I would’ve otherwise lost to booze.  
With Inclusions brilliant recovery workers/nurses and the support network around me I am now able to positively go forward in my life, in sobriety. Thank you so much!  
I also have to remember the fact that I have also achieved this, so after a year and a bit I can finally thank myself too!  
Peace

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: Pandora07
title: Cross contamination concerns
body:
I was at the pre assessment ward with my mum in early Dec 2021. The waiting room have 5 chairs well spaced out. I was in the waiting room for about an hour while mum had her ecg and blood tests done. There were 14 people came through the waiting room in that hour, all using the chairs.  
There was only one nurse that asked her patient to sanitise their hands and wiped the chair with the cleaning wipes. The other did not do either. I think that patients are high risk as it is without being left open to catching covid or other infections. Very disappointed that not simple measures are being met to keep patients safe. My mum has cancer and this would be the last straw if she caught infection due to your staff.

author: filingfy47
title: Covid booster
body: Had my covid booster and flu vaccine at Marks & Spencer Kirkcaldy Fife. As per my 1st and 2nd covid vaccine the staff were all fabulous. Excellent, safe and efficient system in place.  We are so very lucky to have them all.

author: herculessg47
title: Efficient, welcoming and friendlystaff
body: Staff were efficient, welcoming and friendly. No signs of dealing with an unprecedented health situation and just ready to deliver the vaccine programme to as high a standard as possible. Thank you very much

readBy.name: Office of Annabelle Ewing, MSP for Cowdenbeath

title: useless practice
body: This practice must be the worst practice on the isle of sheppey.. message you to book your appointments and when you ring to book there is nothing available and they dont know when they can book you in and furthermore the receptionist are extremely rude..

title: Need more Doctors + support staff
body:
2hrs waiting on the phone, no opening today, no call back today, no appointment tomorrow. 
What is the use, seems they are only able to serve 10-20% of the Community...
We despirately need more docs and supporting staff! Who does the planning and hiring?

title: Awful practice
body: Absolutely awful practice. I've been a patient for more than twenty years but the way I have been treated over the last three weeks is disgusting. I will be changing doctors immediately and would not recommend this surgery to anyone. The attitude of the staff is shocking, I left in tears after being spoken to so horribly.

title: Very happy to recommend
body: Been with the practice for 5 (?) years. 3 children. Like all practices, it can be tricky to get through on the phone immediately,  but whenever it has been urgent or worrying, appointments have been found and the care has been great. My last appointment was for shingles and even though I had no visible signs the GP diagnosed literally within 10 seconds....still not sure how! Had a few referrals to RUH for my children, all made on a timely basis and good follow up. Practice have responded quickly when I have needed information in writing for travel or insurance related queries. I personally think it is great we can get repeat prescriptions by phone and on-line and I like telephone appointments as I work and it is tricky for face to face stuff sometimes.

title: should be ashamed
body: my father who is registered with Haworth medical practice sadly passed away on the 20th of November this year. I visited the practice on the 26th to chase my paperwork and was advised by lady on reception that they were aware of his death and his paperwork was in the doctors tray waiting to be processed. after 3 WEEKS and various call made by the undertaker on my behalf NO PAPERWORK passed to coroners office and i have now had to get myself all upset again to try get this sorted to allow the coroners to do their job and myself and the undertaker to arrange my Dads funeral. Dealing with the death of my Dad is hard enough without having to go through this.

title: Not a great practice
body: The expertise of some of the nurses and doctors at that practice is questionable. 1- I was prescribed an incorrect treatment course by one of the doctors. 2- While some of the nurses are lovely, others are rude and unhelpful and do not welcome any questions from the patient. They just say what they have to say and then gesture toward the door for the patient to leave. Good bedside manners are expected even in the NHS, which is understandably understaffed.

title: awful experience
body: I have been registered with this GP since 2015 and very rarely go there as I am at good health but recently I gave birth to my daughter and requested the practice to convert my baby's private prescription to NHS one in the morning and this was not done till the evening so I went there to ask them do it and I was told that it will not be done till tomorrow as they dont have enough doctors. I requested this at 11:25am and almost 6 hours was not enough time for them to sign a prescription by a GP for 2 weeks old baby. Yes, my baby is 2 weeks old and she is in pain and they just really did not care. Just wondering if they will let their babies to be treated like that would not they ? It was awful experience and I hope that I will not have to deal with them anymore as I am planning to change the practice.

author: Marrt88
title: Inappropriate respite provision
body:
Once we went into adult services, the only respite offered to my child, who is mentally alert and completely verbal, was use of a nursing home.  
They are nearly 30 yrs old and have multi complex needs and requires 24 hr care.  
They uses a powered wheelchair, controlled by with two fingers, and a Bi pap ventilator to breathe and needs a cough assist machine to cough.  
We do not feel that that a nursing home is a suitable form of respite  
We have suggested that four times a year 24 hr care via care provider to be brought to our home  
We have not had respite in nearly 10 yrs.  
We think there is now an urgency about this. As his carer, I am unwell and need a break.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Excellent care
body: My husband, baby and I have all had excellent care from this practice. Quick calls back from GPs and incredibly helpful pharmacists. My husband was seen face to face for 30mins and his GP was so kind and compassionate. I don't know how they're managing after the two years we've had but we are very grateful.

title: Awful with every single encounter
body: Cursory treatment on telephone, when speaking with certain clinicians, dismissive and lazy service. You have to chase and chase to get anywhere whether it’s appointments, results, prescriptions, medication reviews, I’ve had to be referred recently - when I had my procedure they did not have the full information from the practice, messages and complaints sent through web portal are ignored. Every time I have interaction with this surgery I’m left feeling very upset as you just can’t get anywhere. Somebody has pressed the self-destruct button here.

title: Awful
body:
Beyond awfulness. I am lost for words. Patient care is non existent from my experience at this surgery. 
All roads lead to the on line form which is abysmal and totally unfit for purpose. Receptionists who hide behind this on line service and say it’s nothing to do with them. Wtf!!!

title: Unprofessional Practices
body:
I went to collect my blood form on Friday and asked the staff at reception if I could complete the registration process of my wife and son on Saturday. I was informed that new registration is not accepted on Saturdays and I needed to visit on some other working day. 
I managed my office hours earlier on Tuesday and took my wife and three years' old son to the GP for registration. We weren't allowed to enter and to my shock I was told that the registeration can only be done on Saturday. When I discussed with the lady that just 4 days befor I was told a completely different information, she simply replied that the process is changed due to vaccination and now I need to wait till the next Saturday for the registration. It was really disappointing to witness such unethical and unprofessional approach. Such haphazard decisions should have been advertised on website or social media of the GP to let the relevant tax payers know. The registration of my family is delayed for more than a week and all our effort went in vain.

title: Being taken off their register after 32 years
body: After 32 years patient being registered and at same address for the last 10 years  surgery just decided to take whole family off their register.  Reason given    live in wrong area.  Devastating.  Only gp practice ever been registered with since being born but they take on new patients who live further away.

title: Terrible waiting time
body: We’ve been waiting in A&E for 6 hours (midnight to 6am), no idea when a doctor will see our son. We’ve been told we are at the top of the list for the last hour but we still haven’t been called in, it looks like there’s no doctor around.

readBy.name: Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust

title: It used to be excellent
body:
I have been patient in this practice for long time and it was really great, professional friendly and helpful. 
However in the end of 2020 it has changed a lot. It was still good but not really close to the same level of service and friendliness. 
I have decided to change it and hope it will be better place for everyone again.

title: Outrageous
body:
Cannot get through on the phone,  so did online request, as in pain, had email to say message sent and received ,2 days later ,still no call, 

Outrageous service 😥

title: Doctors good but receptionist not
body: Doctors are great but that’s only when you can see or speak to them, the receptionist usually hang up on you or are extremely unhelpful. If you do not ring at 8am you do not get an appointment even then be prepared to be hung up on by the reception team!

title: Receptionist are like a police force
body: I have been with surgery 55 years and seen the same dr all this time seen receptionist come and go these are the worse just trying to get a call back I have waited a week so far.

title: Great practice
body: We are a family of three registered at the surgery, although it took time, but our problems have all been sorted, from Fibromyalgia, bone chip in hubbies wrist, smears for my daughter, female issues and more, the lady I dealt with has been so patient and compassionate, she is awesome. We are moving to Wales and just hope to get the same treatment there. Well done

title: Poor GP and Awful for Antenatal care
body: Impossible to get an appointment with any sort of urgency. Not even same week let alone same day. No resident midwife so very poor for any expectant mothers antenatal care. Always palmed off to e-consult forms. And to top it all off, terribly run down and crummy facilities.

title: A hospital for the Hearing Impaired???
body:
I am severely hearing impaired.
I can find only contact telephone numbers.
Am I missing something or does the hospital not help the hearing impaired?

title: Very difficult to see a GP
body: Appointments to see a GP very scarce  If you want to see a GP expect to have a 5-6 week wait.  As this is the only practice in the area there is not much choice.

title: Reception staff incredibly rude
body: The reception team show a lack of care and patience, they are incredibly rude on the phone and show no understanding of how to speak to patients or people who may be in pain. The medical team are great at this surgery but the front of house lets them down.

title: Disastrous from reception onwards
body:
Disaster!
Reception don’t answer the phone when they should.You will see the video below stating otherwise.Reception are a joke no matter who is behind the desk,gp refuses to listen to my consultant advice to refer me for unrelated covid but very important vaccination or even totally ignoring that my life can depend on it.They asked us to call between 8/10am to make an appointment with the gp for doctor to call us on the day but phones weren’t open at 8:17 as per my video

title: Unable to book an appointment
body: I start work at 8am therefore I am unable to book to call to book an appointment at that time. The surgery has suspended the email service therefore I am now in a position where I am unable to make an appointment with my own GP practice

title: Sick of being spoken down to by receptionists.
body: Getting really fed up of how condescending and rude a couple of the receptionists are at the moment. Always talking over people and patronising. It's making me want to move doctors but my kids are down at this doctors so don't really want to move. You're treated like everything is a hassle. Horrible.

title: Shambles of a doctors surgery.
body: You wait 10 minutes on the phone in the que with just yourself for a receptionist to tell you to ring a different number because she can’t help. So you ring the other number and they tell you it’s through your gp like the message said. I ring back and tell her I need to re book my medication review with the surgery not this other place she gave me the number for and she does it straight away? The young women on the phone was so rude as if she didn’t want to be there. I politely asked if she had an available date and she replied with attitude “na I ain’t”. This surgery really has gone down hill and they really need to employ staff that actually want the work there. I also went in the surgery to collect my prescription a couple of weeks back and all the reception staff were moaning amongst themselves about the job. It’s so unprofessional and maybe they are not being treated right. Over worked and underpaid as always.

title: All that glitters isn’t Gold.
body:
You do everything right, place an order a month before hand, get a email telling you when this order is going to arrive and then your let down with the delivery time of arrival, you then try to get in touch via phone call only to be put on wait for eternity. Living with a Stoma is no fun and the last thing you need is not knowing when or if you’re medical supplies will arrive. 
Being in full time work and managing a Stoma can be tough so the last thing you require is to constantly try to chase up something that should be done competently and professionally from a company you put 100% trust in.

title: Awful place , unfriendly/untrained receptionist
body:
I have been trying to book a requested (by the surgery) telephone appointment with no success. Also I need a repeat prescription for inhalers which I need to either speak to the doctor or attend the surgery. Attending the surgery isn’t an option at the moment as I have to use the local taxi service at a return cost of £10 , so getting to speak to the doctor is quite relevant. The surgery requested I book this telephone appointment with reference to a letter they received from my psychiatrist. Each time I phone the surgery at the requested time of 8 am to get through to someone at approximately 9am only to be told all the slots have gone and to phone back tomorrow, when I question this I was told if it was important they would have booked an appointment, and if I wasn’t happy make a complaint, I requested further information on making a complaint but was told by the receptionist that she didn’t have to give me that information.
 This surly is not acceptable behaviour by the receptionist, her short abrupt response with no leeway for trying to solve my problem was far from helpful. I understand that my mental and physical health issues aren’t important to her personally but in her role as a NHS receptionist she does have a duty of care to the patients with whom she comes into contact with

title: Brilliant service
body: Called practice at 8am - through in 10mins. GP video consultation by 9:30. Antibiotics prescribed and collected by 10:00am. Amazing service. Efficient under great pressure. Have always had good treatment from this practice. Receptionists are extremely helpful and polite. Thank you to the team.

title: Avoid
body:
Staff rude, unhelpful, when you have an appointment the staff are never on time always running late even at 8am when they first open.
Never answer the phone. Ask to speak to practice manager never available and doesn't call back.

title: Disgusted!
body: Was shown a complete lack of respect by the neurologist who I had Tel. consultation with. He said that I didn't have the condition I am known to have and had already been diagnosed with. Asked me how I knew things, that I was not describing my symptoms and that I had read them in a book (I'm registered blind. How many books does he think I read!). Said that he didn't know what I had got and that there was nothing he could do for me, but he prescribed a drug anyway. Despite saying that he didn't know what condition I had, he did not refer me to someone who might know!  The condition that I have has been well diagnosed well before I spoke with this man. He also, asked me questions,. He did not allow me time to answer, and spoke over me when I tried to speak. This is not how I would like to be treated, and experiences like this cause me to not want to go to the NHS for help when I need it.

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Awful practice
body:
The worst GP I've ever experienced, probably the worst organisation I've tried to deal with. You're never allowed to see a doctor, you have to queue for hours on the phone to get through, and most of the time they leave you in the phone queue for 20 minutes and then hang up on you. Even for something as simple as a repeat prescription it takes days of effort just to get through to a receptionist, most of who are just rude and regularly hang up on you. This has lead to me running out of medication several times just from trying to get through on the phone for a prescription!

I see the practice manager replies to bad reviews on here asking the person to get in touch, but doesn't give any contact details. How would we get in touch when it's impossible to reach the practice by phone?

title: Confusing messages
body: I called the practice yesterday to make an appointment to see a doctor (any doctor). I was told there were no appointments that day and to use the ‘Klinik’ access app. A doctor would telephone me ‘in 48 hours’ I explained I felt quite   ill. Was told again to use the app. So frustrating. I made an appointment to see a private GP the same day. Fortunately I could afford to do this. This morning, I received a text informing patients that the Klinik app has been turned off. Apparently, staff are focussing on Covid vaccination centres and the urgent care needs of patients. Who decides what is urgent? Should we phone with concerns that something might be urgent? Or wait until it actually is and telephone 999? I used to think the Pinn was great, but it is now so inaccessible - trying to make an appointment is so stressful. I quite understand the pressure staff are under, but other practices seem to be maintaining  GP services very well. If I am asked who my GP is, I have no idea. For some time I have had to see whoever is available, not a doctor I know and would like to see. The Pinn is too big. If you have a chronic condition and are in the system, the service is better. But if you simply want to see a doctor to discuss an acute condition that is causing pain or discomfort, but is probably not urgent, a timely appointment seems to be almost impossible. Do I now join a private GP practice? It is something I am reluctant to do, but will consider if access to a GP at the Pinn continues to be challenging and stressful.

title: Always been a poor practice
body: I find staff on reception are very rude and unhelpful. Drs are always running late but no one actually advises you of this. Called about a query today as my prescription had been cancelled by them.  On hold for 20 minutes only to be told to call someone else and that I was out of area and needed to register with another gp!

title: Don't Bother
body: Completely useless, was referred in early spring last year due to anxiety and mild depression and ended feeling hopeless and suicidal by the time I was discharged. If you don't go the expected route (responding to CBT in 6 weeks, agreeing to take antidepressants,) they have nothing for you. When you don't improve you're made to feel as though you're the one with the problem and there's nothing more that can be done, then left to struggle on your own.

title: They do not answer the phone
body: Trying to get hold of this practice by telephone is a complete nightmare. Yes we are in a pandemic but I fail to see why that affects a receptionist from being unable to answer a call. We are speaking hold times in excess of 30 plus minutes which is unacceptable. The last thing a person who is feeling unwell wants to do is sit listening to hold music indefinitely and for those who are not on a free call package it costs a fortune. There is no excuse - this needs addressing.

title: Refusing to give me a letter so I can get my…
body: I have had my first two Covid doses abroad, 6 months ago, as I had to have them so I can participate at my own wedding. I went to a walk-in vaccination center to get a booster jab and I have been told that all I need is a letter from my GP that confirms they have a record of my Covid vaccine doses on my record. GP asked me to send over the documentation that proves I've had the doses. I did this in October and did this again the other day, and they still refused to send me a letter. Which means I can't get my booster. Not sure what else to say...

author: NHS Service USer
title: Friendly and professional service
body: Friendly and professional service delivered by Eilis and Geraldine at Downshire. I had two PCR tests carried out - day 2 and day 8. Geraldine was very friendly and helpful. Eilis was very careful and engaging and made the whole process as painless and comfortable as possible. Excellent!

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust
Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: debmumto5
title: A horrible experience having my covid booster
body:
Horrible experience. I can't wear a mask for medical reasons and they had a complete panic in front of people, which was embarrassing. It wasn't just one helper it was three saying I wasn't wearing a mask. People were looking at me.  
They had to put me behind some screens which was fine but the whole experience was awful and I don't want to come again. I suggest that the helpers are trained in looking after people with no mask the same way as people with masks, with respect, and to deal with it quietly. They should understand that there must be a very good reason for someone coming into the vaccine clinic without a mask.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Fee90
title: Supported and professionally cared for
body:
I was informed, supported and professionally cared for during my labour and after. The midwife’s kept to my birth plan as the situation allowed and reminded me of my wishes and choices throughout.  
They kept my partner informed and supported him as well.  
They ensured we were hydrated and fed and had everything we needed.

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland

author: whisperbd48
title: A quick, friendly and professional jab in the arm
body: Booked an appointment yesterday, in this morning for a quick, friendly and professional jab in the arm. Thanks to all of the NHS workers and volunteers who help this to run so smoothly!

author: Waveman
title: Fast and efficient telephone appointment
body: I applied for a telephone appointment with the GP. When I had this, it was very fast and efficient. I explained my problem to the doctor who I found to be was very caring and understanding. I would highly recommend them to anyone needing a GP.

author: pjrey
title: Efficient GP services
body:
Called my GP surgery this morning with a minor issue which was causing me a lot of pain. After a short wait, I gave details to the receptionist who said someone would call back to either do a telephone appointment or ask me to come in. Less than an hour later, I was called back to come in today. I’ve got medication now and should be on the road to recovery soon  
So impressed with my GP surgery - a very slick operation. You hear a lot about GPs not seeing people but that's really not my experience

author: ehay85
title: Reassuring Speech & Language Therapy service
body:
My child attended speech & language therapy within the WHSCT ongoing from age 2, with Developmental Language Disorder. They have just been discharged from treatment. Within this time we met many therapists and attended multiple locations including Great James Street and Waterside. The service provided was always 100% with very dedicated staff who go out of their way to help.  
Initially it was a very worrying time as we had never experienced a speech disorder before and didn’t know what the outcome would be or how long therapy would need to continue or if other interventions would be needed. Thankfully through school and the input of our SLT therapist our child was granted a place within Ebrington Primary School speech unit. This massively helped their progress and really brought them on, and after only one term they were able to return to mainstream class.  
Now the treatment is complete and they are excelling every day, fitting in well with their peers. They have great friends and are participating well and confidently in class. It was always a big concern as to how this would pan out.  
We cannot fault the care provided by the speech and language department and everyone we met was so helpful. We always felt our child was in caring, capable hands. Many thanks to all the staff we have met on our journey and we have been given the reassurance that if we ever need help in the future it will be there.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust
Royal College of Speech and Language Therapists (RCSLT)

author: squatek49
title: Positive covid booster experience
body:
I was very anxious to get my booster asap with the number of covid cases rising so rapidly. I’m in the over 30 bracket so the only option was to come to a walk-in clinic. When I arrived the queue had about 70 people ahead of me. A daunting prospect with a 1 year old full of the cold awaiting my speedy arrival at home. But I committed. And I waited. But I needn’t have worried. The queue moved along so steadily. I was in the building within 35 minutes.  
When I finally reached the front of the line - I was greeted by the kindest eyes behind the usual PPE. He informed me that his name was Gerry and indicated that he and his colleague at the computer would be helping me today. And I suddenly got very emotional. What a privilege to be able to walk in somewhere offering me this potentially life saving medicine…. administered by a trained professional…..for free?!?  
I lost myself for a moment and garbled a "thank you so much for what you are all doing. It really is appreciated. I’m sure you’re knackered….” through my mask. And then proceeded to fight back the tears as he gave me my booster jab and sent me on my way.  
Thank you so much to all the Gerrys working like crazy this December. But really we can’t thank you enough…

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust
